citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
A semiannual evaluation was performed in October 2022, and a corresponding report was prepared and submitted to the
Institutional Official (IO). However, this report to the IO was not signed by a majority of the IACUC members.
Semiannual reports to the Institutional Official ensure that the IO is kept informed regarding the current status of the
animal program and facilities. The semiannual reports must be reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members,
and must include any minority views. This demonstrates consensus amongst the IACUC members, allows the opportunity
for communication of any minority views, and helps to ensure animal health and well-being.
The IACUC must prepare reports of its semiannual evaluations and submit the reports to the Institutional Official at least
once every six months upon completion of the required semiannual evaluations; These reports must be reviewed and
signed by a majority of the IACUC members, and must include any minority views.
To be corrected from this point forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
A semiannual evaluation was performed in October 2022, and a corresponding report was prepared and submitted to the 
Institutional Official (IO). However, this report to the IO was not signed by a majority of the IACUC members. 
 
Semiannual reports to the Institutional Official ensure that the IO is kept informed regarding the current status of the 
animal program and facilities. The semiannual reports must be reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members, 
and must include any minority views. This demonstrates consensus amongst the IACUC members, allows the opportunity 
for communication of any minority views, and helps to ensure animal health and well-being. 
 
The IACUC must prepare reports of its semiannual evaluations and submit the reports to the Institutional Official at least 
once every six months upon completion of the required semiannual evaluations; These reports must be reviewed and 
signed by a majority of the IACUC members, and must include any minority views. 
 
To be corrected from this point forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.

n
